Articles.Content:
As you may know, Google has announsed a prize for a private-funded spacecraft that can reach Moon first. 

And so did Kookle.

 To win the Munar Y Prize you must build a CHEAPEST full-stock spacecraft. You must provide a pic of your craft in VAB/SPH with cost in it (no need for career howewer) and a pic of the spacecraft landed on Mun. A video is even better. NO MULTI-LAUNCHES. Cost is calculated for the whole ship, including the launcher.

EXTRA CREDITS

1. Traveller: as in real prize, must move 500 m away from the landing point.

2. Scientist: have ALL science expiriments on board. 

NO BONUSES
Just doing it.https://youtu.be/3ruAPFXKw4E P.S A twin landing!
This looks like a great way to start off my challenge mode career. I assume that a kerbal is not necessary to be in it and it is just a probe? This should be even easier.

Well, I adopted the slogan "Fairings are for the weak", and did my attempt at this, total cost 4 805 funds. I'd love to slap an RTG on the rover, but that would increase the cost 600%, which was ruled out as not acceptable.

Here's the [craft download](http://kerbalx.com/crafts/1977?download=true)if anyone wants to verify or just curious. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

[![n3iz3aGl.png](http://i.imgur.com/n3iz3aGl.png)](http://i.imgur.com/n3iz3aG.png)[![yMXcrUkl.png](http://i.imgur.com/yMXcrUkl.png)](http://i.imgur.com/yMXcrUk.png)

I also tried to record my attempt, but, apparently, Bandicam doesn't record more than 10 minutes and I noticed that too late, so it's just the first half or so of the flight. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/p3fe-aCy7jY?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Great challenge! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-01T12:54:20Z" title="05/01/2015 12:54  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 1, 2015</time> by juzeris**

> 
> This looks like a great way to start off my challenge mode career. I assume that a kerbal is not necessary to be in it and it is just a probe? This should be even easier.

Of cource you can use probes. Krakenspeed!

Here's my submission. I did it in 3915 funds, and my original flight does not include any of the extras. The flight took a few tries to get it right, but if you time the suicide burn correctly, then you have just enough fuel to land. In my run I didnt do the burn in enough time to get exactly to safe landing, but the probe core made it and still had power production so I deemed it as a success. Here's the [craft download](http://kerbalx.com/jerdrb/Cheap-Probe.craft) if anyone wants to verify.
